law.catch_line: Appeal from Secretary of State's refusal to file document.

text.section: If the Secretary of State refuses to file a document delivered for filing, the entity, foreign entity, or other person making the delivery for filing may appeal the refusal to the Franklin Circuit Court. The appeal shall be commenced by petitioning the court to compel filing the document and by attaching to the petition the document as delivered for filing and the Secretary of State's explanation of the refusal to file.
The court may summarily order the Secretary of State to file the document or take other action the court considers appropriate.
The court's final decision may be appealed as in other civil proceedings.

law.history: Created 2010 Ky. Acts ch. 151, sec. 18, effective January 1, 2011.
